title: Understanding Conditional Formatting
text: Conditional formatting is a feature in spreadsheet applications that allows you to apply specific formatting to cells that meet certain criteria. This can help you visually identify trends, patterns, or outliers in your data.

title: Examples of Conditional Formatting
text: Some common uses of conditional formatting include highlighting cells that contain specific text, changing the color of cells based on their values, or applying data bars to represent the magnitude of values.

hintAnswer: create rules that changes the formatting of a cell based on its value
title: Identifying the Correct Answer
text: Consider what conditional formatting allows you to do in a spreadsheet. Does it involve creating rules that change the appearance of cells based on their content?
choices: create rules that changes the formatting of a cell based on its value
creates structured references for your data
allows references to automatically change based on updated information
allows you to create rules to change the formatting of tables
